meanings.sent1: The recurrence of the same dream every night was unsettling.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the recurrence of the illness was common in winter.
meanings.sent3: The recurrence of his jokes at the party made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The recurrence of her smile brightened up his day like a ray of sunshine.
meanings.sent5: The recurrence of the melody in the song made it catchy and easy to remember.

meanings.definition: The return of a particular event or situation.
meanings.sent1: The recurrence of the annual festival brought joy to the town.
meanings.sent2: The sudden recurrence of the problem caught us off guard.
meanings.sent3: The recurrence of his lost keys was both frustrating and comical.
meanings.sent4: The recurrence of her visits felt like a blessing in disguise.
meanings.sent5: The recurrence of the full moon signaled the start of a new month.
